channel.title: Weird Login Issue? [PI]
channel.description:
If someone were to log in with the name "Billionaire" and log out, another person with the name that has a different case letter (BiLLionaire, billionairE, billionaire, etc.) could log in and out and appear to be the same person, [b]but with a different character file[/b].
Could someone help me out to fix this? Thanks.

item.title: Weird Login Issue? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

The Linux part isn’t the problem, it’s the way Project Insanity reads and writes data. With Linux, of course, any case changes will be noticed. I haven’t worked with PI in a while, but I’m positive it’s going to involve the saving process. Give me a few minutes and I’ll check it out and see what I come across.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Login Issue? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @jrich123 jrich123
item.description:
@jrich123 wrote:

iz3 legend:

Your usernames are case sensitive, change that. Check the login procedure.

I know that, this bug only appears on my CentOS VPS, which is obviously case-sensitive with file management. What I’m confused with is how to make them case insensitive.

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Login Issue? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @iz3_legend iz3 legend
item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

Your usernames are case sensitive, change that. Check the login procedure.

Read full topic
